  • News
  • Videos & Podcasts
  • Advertising
    • } @section deskmenuItems {
  • News
  • Videos & Podcasts
  • Advertising
    • } [... regular HTML with Razor goes here ...] ``` This is a formatted version (Alt+Shift+F). As you can see it's a mess.

data.title: Stop doesn't kill debugged `restart` app

milestone.title: On Deck
milestone.description:
The Issues assigned to the **On Deck** milestone under consideration for the upcoming milestones.
Our goal is to always have less than 100 Issues on deck.

data.body:
Testing #19040

1. Create Nodemon debug sample
2. <kbd>F5</kbd>
3. Hit stop

The terminal will read 

```
[nodemon] app crashed - waiting for file changes before starting...
```

Which indicates nodemon is still running, when it shouldn't.

The problem aggravates once the user presses `F5` again: nothing happens because some input is sent to the Terminal, but it's nodemon and not the shell that handles it. To get out of this state, the user must go to the terminal and <kbd>Ctrl C</kbd>.

Also, in that stopped state, a change in the JavaScript file will restart the server, since nodemon is still running.

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/22350/22249544/bd078dd6-e243-11e6-9b58-27730299e4fb.png)

data.title: Drop of .vsix into extensions viewlet should install it
Shift F4 on the first search result deselects it
data.body:
Testing #19094

1. Do a search
2. Select the first search result
3. Press <kbd>Shift F4</kbd>

No search result will be selected. IMO the selection should stay the same.

data.title: Debounce F4/shift F4
data.body:
Testing #19094

1. Have many search results in the search viewlet
2. Select the first
3. Hold <kbd>Down Arrow</kbd> key

You'll notice that a file will open every 300ms or so, demonstrating the rate limiting.

This UI interaction should use debouncing instead of limiting the rate. We have a [few](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/blob/master/src/vs/base/common/event.ts#L308) [utils](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/blob/master/src/vs/base/common/async.ts#L246) for this.

data.title: Rename `typescript.referencesCodeLens.enabled`
data.body:
Testing #19088

Having `.enabled` seems redundant. The editor setting is `editor.codeLens`. This one should be: `typescript.referencesCodeLens`.

data.title: TypeScript doesn't react to referencesCodeLens config change
data.body:
Testing #19088

1. Open the settings
2. Open a TypeScript file to the side
3. Change `typescript.referencesCodeLens.enabled` to `true`

The TypeScript file will not show the code lens. Only when switching to another file and switching back will the references come up.

data.title: Rename `scrollPreviewWithEditorSelection`?
data.body:
Testing #19085

Changing that setting to `false` disables all features in #19085, not just the scrolling. Given that, shouldn't it be named something lighter and more encompassing such as:

- `markdown.preview.linked`
- `markdown.preview.tracked`
- etc.

data.title: Problem with `setBreakPointsRequest`
data.body:
I've been recently working on creating .Net Framework debugger for Windows. So far everything has been pretty OK, and working well with one small exception - I can't get breakpoints working at all.

As far as I can tell `setBreakPointsRequest` method of my `DebugSession` is never hit. Any idea what I'm doing wrong?

Code of debugger adapter is here: https://github.com/ionide/ionide-vscode-fsharp/blob/debugger/src/Debugger/debugger.fs.

data.title: Multiple sessions (context) save/restore support.
data.body:
It would be nice to add sessions to vscode. Because most of us need to work on several tasks/issues at the same time. Sessions will help us to remember and quickly switch/restore the context of tasks. Possible operations may consist of (by Ctrl+Shift+P):
1. `session save <name>` (default `<name>` -- current git branch)
2. `session load <name>` (default `<name>` -- current git branch, or may be `<last>` session)
3. `session drop <name>` (default `<name>` -- current git branch)
4. `session list [pattern]`

Possible information to remember and restore when session will be loaded could be:
1. Current opened directory (or directories, when it will be possible).
2. A list of opened files with their's cursor positions.
3. A list of recently used files.
4. Current git brunch.
5. Break points, may be?

Perhaps it makes sense to do sessions operations accessible from command line interface. I.e.:
1. `code -s load <name>` -- load session `<name>`
2. `code -s show <name>` -- show preserved session information
3. `code -s list [pattern]` -- list preserved sessions (possible matched to `pattern`)
4. `code -s drop <name>` -- drop session `<name>`
5. `code -s merge <name>` -- open session `<name>` within current vscode editor and not to close already opened files.

vscode version: 1.8.1

data.title: Font ligatures and Haxe function types

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code - Insiders 1.9.0-insider (4265f5e35cb3ea8ba7e0cf6b14ec606b6f8647ea, 2017-01-24T10:37:36.620Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.14986

I'm using the Haxe grammar from the [Haxe Support](https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=nadako.vshaxe) extension. Font ligatures don't always behave like I would expect them to - the reply to [this issue](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/17306#issuecomment-267346855) suggests that they are based on the grammar's tokens.

However, Haxe function types with type parameters don't use the correct ligatures, here it groups `>-` instead of `->`:

![](http://i.imgur.com/3kZxdXn.png)

Adding a space, the arrow uses the ligature I would expect:

![](http://i.imgur.com/eYMgSgj.png)

Our grammar groups them into scopes correctly.

http://i.imgur.com/ZuTZ3w1.png
http://i.imgur.com/JBhllzd.png

With the Java grammar, it suddenly works like expected:

![](http://i.imgur.com/bkqYTZh.png)

The difference seems to be that `>` is scoped as `storage.type.generic.java` there, which doesn't seem correct to me. For Haxe, we use the same one that TS uses, `punctuation.definition.typeparameters.end.hx`.

___________

Another example:

`=>` is turned into a ligature, despite being two different tokens.

http://i.imgur.com/x3j0ryM.png
http://i.imgur.com/vqWMkMV.png

Am I simply misunderstanding how font ligatures work / are we using incorrect scopes?

data.title: Show the selected header in the preview at the same view prot height as the header in the editor
data.body:
Testing #19085 

- VSCode Version: Insiders 
- OS Version: OSX

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open a markdown file and its preview side by side in two editors
2. Select an header in the markdown file

Observed that the preview scrolls and show the corresponding header. But the position it shows is not same as where the selected header is in the main editor. If you start scrolling the preview then you can see a jump in the main editor. Instead showing the selected header at the same view position as in main editor will give better experience

data.title: Settings and panel: font sizes differ
data.body:
I like the new settings and panel pseudo-tab-thingy-style, but having both of them open at the same time looks a little weird, because the font sizes differ. Shouldn't they be the same size, from an UI perspective?

![screen shot 2017-01-24 at 13 13 34](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7542/22246886/500fd230-e237-11e6-8f56-569cb16c7cc0.png)

I'd personally prefer the smaller size from the panel.

data.title: Don't show skip file action for programs
data.body: re #19096 * Launch two debuggees * right click on one of the app nodes in the tree * 🐛 the menu shows the skip file entry

I suggest to just always show 1 edit icon since I can only ever click on one anyway.

data.title: [WelcomeUX] Typos in Interactive Playground
data.body:
While testing #19111:

our" -> "out":
![2017-01-24_13-01-14](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1898161/22246454/5c468f78-e235-11e6-8bfa-a1c6c987112b.png)

"Thats" -> "That's"  and "th" -> "the":
![2017-01-24_13-05-45](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1898161/22246626/ef7088b2-e235-11e6-893f-1e1ba681cca8.png)

"require api" -> "Request API":
![2017-01-24_13-56-54](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1898161/22248031/04fec246-e23d-11e6-899a-fe518a9f5f05.png)

"Since" missing at the start of sentence:
![2017-01-24_14-03-49](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1898161/22248271/10b36000-e23e-11e6-8383-8384a1595efc.png)

"thorough" -> "through":
![2017-01-24_14-08-18](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1898161/22248386/a823e4d2-e23e-11e6-9e0a-c1c55d496909.png)

"you" -> "your":
![2017-01-24_14-11-36](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1898161/22248488/18a3bc3c-e23f-11e6-9ee6-464cb2ff1d74.png)

"is" -> "it":
![2017-01-24_14-13-43](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1898161/22248550/5ef5759a-e23f-11e6-9019-025404f4c56a.png)

"unbound"?
![2017-01-24_14-15-08](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1898161/22248588/8ee1b6b0-e23f-11e6-94e4-007b44a318d9.png)
